conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the system when ball A reaches the highest point.
Ball A is at the highest point, not accelerating vertically.
Net force on ball A must be zero at the highest point.
Force from ball B to ball A must equal force from ball A to ball B.
Rod length is 3L, distance from O to ball A is L, distance from O to ball B is 2L.
Force exerted by ball B on the rod equals force exerted by ball A on the rod.
Force exerted by ball B on the rod is \( 2L \times m \).
Force exerted by ball B on the rod is equal to force exerted by ball A on the rod.
Final answer: Force exerted by ball B on the rod is \( 2L \times m \).
